Key Match Events: The Miami Heat earned a crucial bounce-back 114-98 win against the Golden State Warriors.
Nikola Jovic led the team with 20 points on 8-of-17 shooting, adding six rebounds, four assists, and one steal in 34 minutes.
Bam Adebayo had a terrific all-around bounce-back performance, tallying 19 points and nine rebounds on 9-of-14 shooting.
Jaime Jaquez added 18 points on 7-of-12 shooting with five rebounds.
Duncan Robinson had 12 points on 4-of-5 from deep and dished out a team-most eight assists.
Post-Match Reflections: Miami’s win on Tuesday snaps their three-game losing streak, moving them to 18-17.
The Heat will now try to enact revenge on the Utah Jazz, who beat them by 36 last week inside Kaseya Center, on Thursday.
